intro: Cerionanthus vaillantii, commonly known as the Vaillant's cerion, is a rare and delicate plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in the unique microclimates of its endemic habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
